meanings.definition: To cause anger or resentment in someone.
meanings.sent1: His rude behavior was outraging his friends.
meanings.sent2: The unfair decision was outraging the entire community.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey kept outraging the grumpy old man by stealing his hat.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise from the construction site was outraging her sense of peace.
meanings.sent5: The politician's scandalous actions were outraging the public's sense of justice.

meanings.definition: To violate the moral or ethical standards of someone.
meanings.sent1: The corrupt company was outraging the principles of honesty.
meanings.sent2: The thief's actions were outraging the values of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey kept outraging the grumpy old man by stealing his hat.
meanings.sent4: The scandalous behavior of the celebrity was outraging the expectations of decency.
meanings.sent5: The dictator's oppressive laws were outraging the basic rights of the citizens.
